newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume falls on cash shortage.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume falls on cash shortage.

text.p: Istanbul gold volume fell on Friday due to low demand caused by a cash shortage.
Gold gained $0.40 to end at $388.00 per ounce, and rose 4,750 lira to 1,080,750 lira per gram. Volume dropped by 14.5 percent to 872 kg.

Dealers said trade had been dull on the Istanbul Gold Exchange as demand from the free market had dropped. Most free market dealers had filled their bullion needs earlier this week and there was a cash shortage in the money market.
There was 497 kg of trade in the morning and 375 kg in the afternoon. Of the total trade, 60 percent was in dollar terms.
